title: [XSS] Stored cross-site scripting 2
desc:
Stored cross-site scripting (also known as second-order or persistent XSS) arises when an application receives data from an untrusted source and includes that data within its later `HTTP` responses in an unsafe way.

![image.png](poc-img:img_1756801858047_hb85hoe2z)

Description

title: Reflected XSS in 2ClickPortal
desc: Improper neutralization of input during web page generation vulnerability in 2ClickPortal software allows reflected cross-site scripting (XSS). An attacker might trick somebody into using a crafted URL, which will cause a script to be run in user's browser. This issue affects 2ClickPortal software versions from 7.2.31 through 7.6.4.
